definition: Guan Yu (-219), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, fearsome fighter famous for virtue and loyalty/posthumously worshipped and identified with the guardian Bodhisattva Sangharama
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
feather/5th note in pentatonic scale

sentences.english: Pang shot an arrow at Guan who was unable to dodge it.
sentences.chinese: 龐德取箭，關羽躲閃不及中箭，回營養傷。

sentences.english: The worship of GUAN Yu is popular in China.
sentences.chinese: 關羽崇拜是民間信仰中較爲突出的信仰形態之一。

sentences.english: Guan Yu was hit by a poisonous arrow in the right arm while attacking Fancheng City.
sentences.chinese: 關羽攻打樊城時，被毒箭射中右臂。

sentences.english: The man was named Guan Yu.
This can be proved from the evolvement of Guan Yu's image.
sentences.chinese: 這需要從關羽形象演化史中去探究。

sentences.english: When Guan Yu returned with Hua Xiong's head， the wine in the cup was still warm.
sentences.chinese: 當關羽提華雄人頭進帳時，那杯酒還微微燙手。

sentences.english: The "Forest of Guan Yu" is one of the three major memorial temples of Lord Guan.
sentences.chinese: 關林廟是關羽的三個紀念廟宇之一。

sentences.english: Determined to take over Fancheng City, Guan refused to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 關羽決心攻下樊城，不肯退。

sentences.english: Lord Guan eyed Liu Bei, who sensed his brother's intent and rose to bid Zhou Yu farewell.
sentences.chinese: 關羽給劉備使眼色，劉備會意，起身告辭。

definition: Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
Zhao Yun (-229), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
Zhang Fei (168-221), general of Shu and blood-brother of Liu Bei in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, famous as fearsome fighter and lover of wine
Huang Zhong (-220), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms, portrayed as an old fighter
Jing Ke (-227 BC), celebrated in verse and fiction as would-be assassin of King Ying Zheng of Qin 秦嬴政 (later the First Emperor 秦始皇)
capable person
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty

Zhuge Liang (181-234), military leader and prime minister of Shu Han 蜀漢|蜀汉 during the Three Kingdoms period/the main hero of the fictional Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义, where he is portrayed as a sage and military genius/mastermind
Ma Chao (176-222), general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
Shu Han (c. 200-263), Liu Bei's kingdom in Sichuan during the Three Kingdoms, claiming legitimacy as successor of Han
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
Xiang Yu the Conqueror (232-202 BC), warlord defeated by first Han emperor
to confront/to face the enemy
Lü Bu (-198), general and warlord
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
